Knowing the Basics of Police Recruitment

Police officers are essential and important to any society. The Force is there to ensure security, peace and order. That is why many governments actually highly regard police forces. Also, because it is a necessary component of maintaining peace and order, there are many opportunities for people who choose being a police officer as their respective careers. Because police officers actually serve the public, they are highly thought of in the community where they belong.

This career offers decent pay and a relatively high pension. Plus, there are no age limits and minimal educational requirements for aspiring police recruits. No wonder, so many people truly want to join the police especially in times of economic downturn.

However, it is also true that not all applicants are able to this and in fact, many are actually very disappointed when they finally see the results of their respective applications. It is currently estimated 3 out of 4 people who apply don’t make it through the first stage.

Remember that if you want to become an officer, there is a specific application process that you must undergo. The result of this application process would surely determine whether you will become a police officer or not and you need to pass every stage. When you are able to understand the basics of police recruitment, you are able to prepare for it, and as a result there is a greater chance that your dream of becoming a successful police officer will come true. Try to take a look at the basics of police recruitment , in order to increase your chances of success.

1. Answering the application form
Obviously, the first thing that you will have to do when you want to become a police officer is complete the police application form. However, you must not just take this lightly. By simply answering this sheet of paper, you are actually already giving an impression to examiners. That is why you must ensure that you are answering the application form properly and diligently.

2. Being assessed
The second part of the police recruitment process is the assessment centre. For most applicants, this may be the most decisive part of the whole recruitment process. This is because it is in this part wherein the applicant is going to be assessed for whether he/she actually fits the conditions and requirements of becoming a police officer. Usually, this part includes competency interviews, numerical and verbal exams, and interactive exercises. In this part, you must able to be competent and skilled enough, if you want to pass in the end. You need to really prepare for these exams.

3. Undergoing medical examinations
You are going to be checked on your physical fitness and health condition. This part will identify whether you have an illness, or other kinds of diseases. You have to make sure that you are in good health and in reasonal shape. Prepare well with good exercise and a balanced diet. Being perfectly healthy is surely a plus factor.

4. Finally, the fitness examination.
This part would determine whether your physical abilities can match the demands of becoming a police officer.

Knowing the 7 Key Skill Areas of a Police Officer

It is very easy to see why many people right now are actually dreaming of becoming a police officer especially as it is considered one of the safe jobs especially in a recession. Being a police officer offers one of the most promising careers that any person might realize. Remember that the police force is highly regarded and seen as an integral part of society. This is because the police are primarily responsible for internal security, peace and order and crime reduction. Because of this fact, this profession is also highly paid in comparison to a number of other jobs.

Plus, when you become a police officer , the force generously matches your pension contributions. However, not all people who want to become police officers actually are able to become one. Statistics show that 3 out of 4 candidates who apply actually do not pass even the first stage of the police recruitment process, which is answering the police application form.

If you still want to become a police officer, it is important for you to know the 7 basic skills that examiners are looking for. When you are able to prepare for these 7 basic skills, most likely, you can finally pass the police recruitment process.

Keep in mind the following when you are undergoing the application process:

1. Community and Consumer Focus
Obviously, when you join the police force, you will serve the community and protect the public. This is the reason why it is important for you to have a focus on the community and on the consumers. Keep in mind that police officers are public servants therefore, you must be able to show that you understand this aspect of the job profile.

2. Diversity
Every police officer is expected to handle diverse personalities and different kinds of situations on a daily basis. In order for you to handle this, you must be able to show diversity, and must be able to cope with every situation in a clam relaxed manner. You must show you respect and treat people equally.

3. Resilience
It is natural for police officers to experience failure in their fight against crime. There will be times where things are not going the right way as expected. In this case, you also must be able to show examiners that in face of adversity, you can still provide protection and service to the community. This is a key factor when you want to pass the police recruitment process.

4. Effective Communication
In solving problems in the community, it is necessary that police officers must effectively communicate, whether to their superiors, or to team mates, or even to the communities affected.

5. Problem Solving
Obviously, as a public servant, police officers are very likely to encounter serious problems. Remember that your aim is to help and resolve peoples problems when issues arise. It is often the ability of the officer to think on their feet that makes them ideal for this role. There are also times wherein quick decisions are needed to be made. It is therefore necessary that you have good problem solving skills.

6. Personal Responsibility
Police officers are responsible for peace and order, so there is no space for irresponsibility. For you to secure the community and provide protection to people, you must be responsible yourself and the actions you take.

7. Team Work
No community problem can be solved by a single police officer. You must be able to become a team player when you want to solve problems effectively and efficiently. This is a must when you want to become a police officer someday.

Passing The Police Role Play

If you want to become a police officer, chances are, you are going to face some difficulties. This is because most people actually fail the police recruitment test. One reason behind this fact is because of the number of people applying for this role. Due to the promising career that one may have when being a police officer, there are just so many applicants trying to become one.

Plus, you must remember that in many cases, examiners are actually choosing only the best of the best among all applicants. If you really want to become a police officer, then, you must be able to score highly on the police recruitment examinations. Doing this may require much skill and ability but most of all practice. If you to prepare effectively, most likely, you have good chances of passing the police recruitment process.

One of the most difficult parts of the process is the police role play. Here, evaluators would actually assess how you respond to certain situations, and if your actions would fit accordingly. Many people are not able to realize their dream of becoming a police officer just because they failed this test. Plus, when you got a low score on only one part of the role play, due to competition, you will likely find yourself rejected. Here are some tips that may help you gain a higher score on the police role play:

• Keep in mind the core competencies of a police officer
The basic reason why evaluators are actually making this test is for them to see if you actually have the core competencies of a police officer. Of course, these evaluators expect you to display these core competencies when in the middle of a certain situation. Therefore, when you are in the activity phase of the role play, keep in mind these core competencies, and let this be the guide to your actions.

• You must be able to read the role play scenario quickly and appropriately.
Aside from this, there are always certain objectives that are behind a certain role play scenario. If you really want to pass this part, it is important for you to actually read quickly what this scenario is all about. When you are able to do so, then surely, you can guide your actions and responses accordingly. Remember that whatever scenario this may be, whether a case of a bullying child or a case of theft, as long as you prepared for it, you will surely do well.

• Be sure to take notes beforehand
Of course, it is still wise for you if you are able to take down notes. There is a preparation phase before the actual activity phase, so take advantage of it. Do not forget to take notes about how you read this role play or bullet points on what will be your actions.

Following these simple tips may mean the difference when you want to pass the police recruitment process and finally become a police officer .

Overall, with the guidance of these guidelines and a persevering and honest desire to serve, the test will be passed with flying colors.

Substantially, joining the police recruitment process is all regarding character and integrity. Candidates would also perfectly fit the job if public service is in their heart. Know How To Become A Police Officer

If you aspire to become a police officer , you will have to to be in the best possible physical condition. It is important that you have sufficient muscle mass, endurance and agility in order to perform your duties competently. So how can you ready yourself for the obligatory physical exam?

Ensure that you give yourself with enough time to prepare your body for the exam. You will be unable to build muscle mass overnight. Let yourself a minimum of six to twelve weeks to train and build your endurance prior to the date your exam will be held. Being prepared well in advance will smooth the progress of your success.

It’s a good idea to inquire your local police unit what the physical agility test will include. Most of them consist of running, sit-ups and push-ups, but other things may also be involved. They may even require that you meet a certain body fat percentage. If you know what will be tested, you can then develop your training accordingly. You must work on improving the areas that are weakest. For many people, this means building muscle mass.

One of the best ways to achieve muscle mass is through using calisthenics. As a law enforcement official, you will need to be strong enough to squat, twist, reach, stretch, lunge, jump & land with strength in order to perform your duties with ease. Practicing calisthenics allows your body to do all of these moves fluidly. They help build strength, promote stamina, and promote a complete range of motion, which reduces the chance of injuries.

Calisthenics are also known as bodyweight exercises as they do not require the use of any equipment. You only require a little area to exercise in and a little time. The most common calisthenics include jumping jacks, sit-ups, crunches, push-ups, pull-ups, squats, calf raises and dips. Start exercising based on your current physical condition. In order to gain muscle mass, you should work to build up the number of reps and degree of difficulty for each exercise at regular intervals.

One more way of building muscle mass is by the use of free weights or exercise equipment. If you don’t have these things, you can join a local gym or YMCA. You can hire a personal trainer, or learn how to train on your own. A proper workout should exercise the chest, back, shoulders, thighs, calves and arms.

But building muscle mass is not simply achieved by exercising. You will need to think about your eating habits as well. To facilitate building muscle mass, your body needs special nutrition. This piece of the puzzle is often dismissed, but it can significantly intensify your results. Your diet should consist of plenty of clean protein, including egg whites, poultry, fish, legumes, and lean red meat. Many people also like to supplement whey or soy protein. You will also need to consume lots of slow burning carbohydrates, including oatmeal and yams. These will provide you with the building blocks it needs to gain muscle mass. And be sure to drink loads of water!

Basically, if you want to ace the physical examination to become a police officer, it’s essential that you start early and exercise often. Proper training, combined with the proper nutrition will get you into top physical condition, so you can finally enjoy your new career as a police officer!

There are many vital characteristics required for a person to become a police officer and the following only covers a few.



When deciding to become a police officer each individual will be test for specific psychological traits including the most important trait, honesty. Honesty is essential to become a police officer since the job requires constant involvement with the community and honesty helps build relationships and trust with the local people. This characteristic also helps to define your role as a role model for others and a standing pillar of strength and integrity in the community. Your honesty will be tested in the police recruitment process to become a police officer during the application process as well as in the documentation of your medical and financial history. Strength is the next trait that is required to become a police officer. Both mental and physical strength are incorporated in this characteristic of strength. The physical strength necessary to become a police officer is important due to the physical requirements you may be subjected to in upholding the law against the criminal element. Mental strength is also an important trait when dealing with the criminal element as they will constantly test you patience and intelligence for their own benefit. It is important that you maintain composure and have the ability to let the small things go so that the job does not become overwhelming for you. Mental and physical strength are absolute requirements when desiring to become a police officer.

Another top characteristic to become a police officer is found in compassion. Compassion is necessary in a variety of aspects to become a police officer. Compassion will first be used in relation to the victims that you will attempt to help in your work experiences. These individuals are normally innocent bystanders that have been victimized by random events, resulting in a lifelong personal scar. It is essential to embrace your compassionate traits when assisting these victims during this time of difficulty.

In the opposite direction, to become a police officer an individual must also find compassion with the criminal element. This may be the most difficult area of development but is necessary to perform your job. It is important not to group the criminal elite and remember that every case has its own unique individuals with their own unique set of circumstances. Beating The Police Recruitment Process

Many individuals are aware of the police and the services those men and women provide to protect the citizens of their community. What many individuals are unaware of are the many steps that are taken in order for an individual to pass police recruitment and obtain the opportunity to become a police officer . Police recruitment is a vital function in attaining new police officers, laying down a foundation of reviews and obstacles in picking out the next class of officers.

Being a police officer is one of the most important positions in any community’s environment. Police recruitment assists in eliminating the weak persons who would not perform to standards and assist in recruiting the strongest persons to execute these duties. Without the implementation of police recruitment a department could hire any individual with their own set of guidelines leading to a vast difference in police procedure. This inequality inside the police force can cause department turmoil, resulting in a reduced level of safeguarding for the community.



When a person comprehends the value of police recruitment it is crucial for them to determine if they have the fortitude to complete the police recruitment phases. These police recruitment phases are designed to test the resolve of an individual as well as look deep into the history of the individual. For those individuals with shady pasts the opportunities they will find in the police recruitment phases will be limited. Police departments are looking for the best individuals in their community or county and a negative criminal history usually places you off the list.

In addition to a thorough background check the police recruitment phases also test an individual intellectually, physically and in real world situations. This is to assess the mental capacity of an individual, see the limitations of their physical abilities and test their reactive abilities to various situations they may encounter in the field. It is important to make sure that you have the drive to rise above the police recruitment phases, beating the expectations of the police recruitment officers.

When you have the drive to rise above the rest and understand the importance behind police recruitment the only thing left is to attempt becoming a police officer. Keep in mind that there are thousands of candidates every year making your level of competition very high. When you do begin the process of police recruitment you should focus on doing the best that you can do and not be concerned regarding the performances of other candidates.

On many occasions potential candidates get concerned regarding others achievements and try to perform at to high of a level, ultimately sabotaging their own efforts in passing the police recruitment phase. Remember that there are many phases of police recruitment that you cannot monitor so although an individual may achieve the highest marks in an event that you can observe they may be suffering elsewhere.

Police recruitment is a trying process and as a potential candidate you need to focus on your abilities and what you can offer a department.
